title.narrative: 2.2. ADOLESCENTS HEALTH

description.narrative: By 2021, integrated care models for health and nutrition for adolescents will have been adapted and implemented for the priority territories., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Child Health, Child Health (Covid), Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Hiv Prevention, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the adolescent population will have improved opportunities to live a healthy life, learn throughout their life and fully exercise their citizenship

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, integrated care models for health and nutrition for adolescents will have been adapted and implemented for the priority territories.

description.narrative: UNICEF's technical assistance, policy dialogue, and evidence generation contributed to the approval of the 2019 Health Guidelines for Comprehensive Adolescent Healthcare, with a focus on sexual, reproductive, mental health and nutrition services. Key recommendations have been developed to overcome barriers to health insurance for adolescents and expand coverage for pregnancy and mental health related topics. Local level capacity building initiatives contributed to improving budgeting allocation and adolescent access to health services in selected regions. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of selected local governments that develop strategies for the promotion of health and nutrition related to the postponement of the pregnancy and the adoption of healthy lifestyle habits.

target.value: 2021:4 selected districts have a communication strategy and updated it.

actual.value:
2019:3: Coronel Portillo, Yarinacocha y Manatay in Ucayali.
For all regions, priority has been given to strengthening health services. Once the health services are in better conditions, work will begin with other community actors, including the local government.

title.narrative: Status of UNICEF supporting Health System Strengthening in context of COVID-19; disaggregated by type of support: (Yes/No) [COVID]

actual.value: 2020:- Supported normative changes that guranteed the care of adolescents in COVID 19 context - Provided technical assitance to 10 Primary Health Care Centers for the reactivation of adolescent oriented services
